items.title: Foundation 6 carousel - replacing HTML
items.body:
We have a Foundation 6 carousel on page and it is initiated by the following when the page initially loads:

$(document).foundation();

However, in some cases (e.g. for users from a specific country) we want to dynamically load alternative HTML for this carousel replacing the existing code:

$.get( host_base + "/personalisation/india/homepage-promo-area", function(html) {
    $( "#homepage-promo-area" ).html( html );
    $( "#homepage-promo-area" ).foundation(); // re-apply foundation to new code
});

..however, although I can see the new HTML is in place, the carousel is not initialised and the slide divs are just stacked on top of each other. Am I doing something wrong here? I've checked that the HTML is the same structure as the existing, even just loading the exact HTML I'm replacing - still the carousel doesn't re-initialize after the new HTML is in place.

items.title: Different behaviours when intercepting throwed error in switch default or case (React/Redux)
items.body:
I have this reducer and these two middleware's

...

const reducer  = (
    state = {
        username : '',
        token : '?'
    }, 
    action
) => {
    switch (action.type){
        case 'SET_TOKEN': 
            state = { ...state, token : action.payload }
            break
        case 'SET_USERNAME': 
            state = { ...state, username : action.payload }
            break
        case 'SET_USERNME': 
            throw new Error("Errore, nessuna azione corrispondente")
            break               
    }
    return state
}

const logger = (store) => (next) =>(action) => {

  console.log(store, next, action);
  next(action);

}

const error = (store) => (next) =>(action) => {
  try{
    console.log("Checking errors");
    next(action);
  }catch(e){
    console.log("Error is: " +e);
  }
}

const middleware = applyMiddleware(logger, error);

...

Now when I dispatch an action 'SET_USERNME' to it, I receive the error message to my console that says: there is an error but the app continue to work. But I can't understand why. if I change the switch part as so, I do not receive a console message anymore but an error.

    switch (action.type){
        case 'SET_TOKEN': 
            state = { ...state, token : action.payload }
            break
        case 'SET_USERNAME': 
            state = { ...state, username : action.payload }
            break

items.body_markdown:
I have an issue with [the latest version of Keras][1]. I would like to provide an auxiliary input to `ConvLSTM2D` that will act as the initializer of the layer memory.

This feature is supposed to be implemented, however, the following code

    from keras.layers import Input
    from keras.models import Model
    from keras.layers.convolutional_recurrent import ConvLSTM2D
    
    latent_dim, mesh_size = 10, (20, 20)
    prior_in = Input(shape=mesh_size + (latent_dim, ))
    core_in = Input(shape=(None, ) + mesh_size + (1, ))
    core_out = ConvLSTM2D(latent_dim, activation='elu', kernel_size=(3, 3),
                        padding='same')(core_in, initial_state=[prior_in, prior_in])
    model = Model([prior_in, core_in], core_out)

raises

      File "tst.py", line 9, in <module>
        padding='same')(core_in, initial_state=[prior_in, prior_in])
      File "python-3.5.4.amd64\lib\site-packages\keras\layers\convolutional_recurrent.py", line 320, in __call__
        output = super(ConvRNN2D, self).__call__(full_input, **kwargs)
      File "python-3.5.4.amd64\lib\site-packages\keras\layers\recurrent.py", line 497, in __call__
        inputs, initial_state, constants, self._num_constants)
      File "python-3.5.4.amd64\lib\site-packages\keras\layers\recurrent.py", line 2247, in _standardize_args
        assert initial_state is None and constants is None
    
    AssertionError

On the other hand, this feature seems to be [unit tested][2].

After some debugging, I have found the difference between the code that is unit tested and my code is that `K.is_keras_tensor(initial_state)` is True only for the code posted above. This is important when the program reaches [convolutional_recurrent.py line 313][3]. If I manually disable the if clause by changing the line 313 to

    if False and K.is_keras_tensor(additional_inputs[0]):

The error is not raised and it is possible to train, save, load the model and to use it for prediction without any issues.

The question is: Does anybody observe the same behavior? Do you have any suggestion how to solve the issue on the client side (without modifying Keras source code)? Can anybody explain what is the piece of code in the `if` clause for*)? 

*) Looking into [history][4], it was copy-pasted from LSTM implementation introduced [here][5].


  [1]: https://github.com/keras-team/keras/tree/2.1.6
  [2]: https://github.com/keras-team/keras/blob/2.1.6/tests/keras/layers/convolutional_recurrent_test.py
  [3]: https://github.com/keras-team/keras/blob/2.1.6/keras/layers/convolutional_recurrent.py
  [4]: https://github.com/keras-team/keras/pull/9094
  [5]: https://github.com/keras-team/keras/pull/5795
items.title: ConvLSTM2D initial_state assertion error
items.body:
I have an issue with the latest version of Keras. I would like to provide an auxiliary input to ConvLSTM2D that will act as the initializer of the layer memory.

This feature is supposed to be implemented, however, the following code

from keras.layers import Input
from keras.models import Model
from keras.layers.convolutional_recurrent import ConvLSTM2D

latent_dim, mesh_size = 10, (20, 20)
prior_in = Input(shape=mesh_size + (latent_dim, ))
core_in = Input(shape=(None, ) + mesh_size + (1, ))
core_out = ConvLSTM2D(latent_dim, activation='elu', kernel_size=(3, 3),
                    padding='same')(core_in, initial_state=[prior_in, prior_in])
model = Model([prior_in, core_in], core_out)

raises

  File "tst.py", line 9, in <module>
    padding='same')(core_in, initial_state=[prior_in, prior_in])
  File "python-3.5.4.amd64\lib\site-packages\keras\layers\convolutional_recurrent.py", line 320, in __call__
    output = super(ConvRNN2D, self).__call__(full_input, **kwargs)
  File "python-3.5.4.amd64\lib\site-packages\keras\layers\recurrent.py", line 497, in __call__
    inputs, initial_state, constants, self._num_constants)
  File "python-3.5.4.amd64\lib\site-packages\keras\layers\recurrent.py", line 2247, in _standardize_args
    assert initial_state is None and constants is None

AssertionError

On the other hand, this feature seems to be unit tested.

After some debugging, I have found the difference between the code that is unit tested and my code is that K.is_keras_tensor(initial_state) is True only for the code posted above. This is important when the program reaches convolutional_recurrent.py line 313. If I manually disable the if clause by changing the line 313 to

if False and K.is_keras_tensor(additional_inputs[0]):

The error is not raised and it is possible to train, save, load the model and to use it for prediction without any issues.

The question is: Does anybody observe the same behavior? Do you have any suggestion how to solve the issue on the client side (without modifying Keras source code)? Can anybody explain what is the piece of code in the if clause for*)?

*) Looking into history, it was copy-pasted from LSTM implementation introduced here.

items.title: Html to image JEditorPane with inline image
items.body:
I'm trying to convert a simple html string with an inline image into an image. I'm using JEditorPane to convert Html and save as image. But, After conversion the saved image has corrupted inline image. What am I missing?

I tried many solutions but all went in vain.

Here is my code.

String html = "<html> <h1>Hello</h1>Hello World!<br><img src=\"/home/test/Pictures/abc.jpeg\"></html>";
int width = 2000, height = 1280;
BufferedImage image = GraphicsEnvironment.getLocalGraphicsEnvironment().getDefaultScreenDevice()
        .getDefaultConfiguration().createCompatibleImage(width, height);

Graphics graphics = image.createGraphics();

JEditorPane jep = new JEditorPane("text/html", html);
jep.setSize(width, height);
jep.print(graphics);

ImageIO.write(image, "JPEG", new File("/home/test/Image.jpeg"));

Here is the output

Where else the actual output should be

(Note: This is the output of the html string used)

How to display it properly? Also I want to auto resize the image according to the html.

If something else other than JEditorPane to be used please mention it. It's a spring boot code and I prefer to use internal libraries rather than external ones.

items.title: How to fix newline error in json
items.body:
Im generating json from Email in Outlook using VBA and content of Meetingitem.Body includes newlines. When I include this content in my json as a string, I get an error. Is it possible to somehow avoid this?

{"fields": {
    "project": {
        "id": 30611
    },
    "summary": "Release Produktion-System",
    "description": "Guten Tag

Sie erhalten diese Terminanfrage weil Ihnen im Change 2018.04.24.015 <http://pww.post.ch/appl/oe/it/changemanagement/wpl/pages/editchange.aspx?changeId=29774>  die im Betreff aufgeführte Tätigkeit zugeordnet wurde. Bitte bestätigen Sie die Terminanfrage im Outlook, damit für die Ausführung der Tätigkeit der entsprechende Zeitraum in Ihrem Kalender reserviert wird.
(Unter offene Termine die entsprechende Tätigkeit mit Bearbeiten öffnen, und den Status anpassen. Es stehen Ihnen folgende Abschlussstatus zur Verfügung: Erledigt, Verzögert, Abgebrochen).

Freundliche Grüsse
Muster Mus

Musterfirma
Informatik

Telefon: +553344556622
Email: muster.muss@mail.com

",
    "issuetype": {
        "name": "Test"
    }
}
}

Its a POST request to server and here is the response that i got:

{
    "errorMessages": [
        "Illegal unquoted character ((CTRL-CHAR, code 13)): has to be escaped using backslash to be included in string value\n at [Source: org.apache@4jasdn4; line: 6, column: 28]"
    ]
}

To generate this json Im using following code (schort variant):

Dim smry, descrp, jsTest As String
smry = """summary"""
descrp = """description"""
jsTest = "{" + smry + ":" + """" + CStr(Msg.Subject) + """" + "," + descrp + ":" + """" + CStr(Msg.Body) + """" + "}"

items.title: Creating Matrices as Dyadic Products of Vectors
items.body:
I am given two vectors u and v of length m and n and want to create from them a matrix A with m rows and n columns as a generalized dyadic product of u and v, i.e.
A[i][j] = f(u[i],v[j]);

Is there already a boilerplate solution for that kind of matrix generation available in Python, e.g. in NumPy, resp., what would be the "most pythonic" way of solving it?

items.title: Get the current value in bootstrap-select
items.body:
I used e.target.value to retrieve the current selected value from bootstrap-select but it returned the first selected value. How can I get the value for the current selection?

And how can I get how many options selected?

   <select multiple class="selectpicker" multiple data-selected-text-format="count > 1">
    <option value="item 1">Item 1</option>
    <option value="item 2">Item 2</option>
    <option value="item 3">Item 3</option>
    <option value="item 4">Item 4</option>
    <option value="item 5">Item 5</option>


$('.selectpicker').change(function (e) {
    alert(e.target.value);
});

It kept showing item 1 even when item 2 was selected like 'item 1, item 2' instead of 'item 2'.

For the number of how many selected, I have no clue. Thanks in advance.

items.title: In the centos6.5 system deployment gym environment error
items.body:
I installed and deployed the gym on the centos6.5 system. The following is the installation process.

  1. Install anaconda

Wget --no-check-certificate https://repo.anaconda.com/archive/Anaconda3-5.1.0-Linux-x86_64.sh

  1. Create a virtual environment Conda create --name gymlab python=3.6

  2. Install gym Source activate gym Git clone https://github.com/openai/gym.git Cd gym Pip install '.[all]'

Run "pip install '.[all]' "The last step, reported the following error: Processing /root/gym Requirement already satisfied: numpy>=1.10.4 in /root/anaconda3/envs/gymlab/lib/python3.6/site-packages
